thread.title: The Top 10 Hip Hop Singles & Videos Of The Week: André 3000, Drake & Wizkid
thread.title_full: The Top 10 Hip Hop Singles & Videos Of The Week: André 3000, Drake & Wizkid

author: Cherise Johnson
title: The Top 10 Hip Hop Singles & Videos Of The Week: André 3000, Drake & Wizkid
text:
0 
This week, Justin Hunte gives a compelling argument for why André 3000 may or may not be considered the greatest of all time. Drake and 21 Savage’s “Sneakin'” video found it’s way back into the top 3 Hip Hop singles and videos of the week and Wizkid’s Drizzy-assisted cut “Hush Up The Silence” maintains it’s top position. André 3000 Is GOAT 
As half of Outkast, André 3000 is one the most treasured Hip Hop figures within the culture. While most people are excited over a 3 Stacks feature, fans and lovers of the genre have yet to experience a solo project from him and for this, many are reluctant to include him in the GOAT conversations. 
Is it warranted? Justin Hunte breaks it down. The Love For Drake & 21 Savage’s “No Sneakin'” Video Reigns Supreme 
“No Sneakin'” is a clear fan favorite as it’s time in the Top 10 list has been cemented since November. 
The track originally debuted on OVO Radio and the visual was released on Apple Music as a low-res video filmed within the confines of the YOLO Estates. Wizkid’s Drake-Featured Track “Hush Up The Silence” Remains Hot 
Nigerian superstar Wizkid teamed up with Drake for another banger, “Hush Up The Silence.” Since it’s release, traffic for this cut has remained high. 
The two have had major success with VIEWS cut “One Dance,” and this song seems to be doing just as well. 
View the Top 10 most popular singles and videos on DX for the week ending February 3 below:
